00035 #if !defined(_XED_ILD_H_)
00036 # define _XED_ILD_H_

00045 /* ILD-related defines:
00046  *
00047  * XED_ILD - for building ILD module 
00048  * XED_ILD_CHECK  for using ILD module in decoding and checking 
00049  *                results against regular decode
00050  * XED_ILD_ONLY - for using only ILD for length decoding, without
00051  *                regular decoding. This is for performance measurements.
00052  */
00053 
00054 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_modrm_mod(xed_uint8_t m) { return m>>6; }
00055 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_modrm_reg(xed_uint8_t m) { return (m>>3)&7; }
00056 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_modrm_rm(xed_uint8_t m) { return m&7; }
00057 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_sib_scale(xed_uint8_t m) { return m>>6; }
00058 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_sib_index(xed_uint8_t m) { return (m>>3)&7; }
00059 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t xed_sib_base(xed_uint8_t m) { return m&7; }
00060 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t bits2bytes(xed_uint_t bits) { return bits>>3; }
00061 
00062 /*
00063  * To allow the ILD to record information for nonpublic extensions, we
00064  * allow adding fields to the xed_ild_extended_t at compile time by
00065  * generating xed-ild-extension.h that defines
00066  * xed_ild_extended_t type.  The implication of this model, is that
00067  * downstream extension models must be supersets of all the extensions that
00068  * they compose with. FIXME: cook up a way to synthesize/generate the
00069  * xed-ild-extension.h file and type definition from all the fields in
00070  * relevant models at compile time.
00071  */
00072 
00073 #include "xed-ild-extension.h"
00074 
00075 
00076 typedef enum {
00077     XED_ILD_MAP0=0,
00078     XED_ILD_MAP1=1,
00079     XED_ILD_MAP2=2,
00080     XED_ILD_MAP3=3,
00081     XED_ILD_MAPAMD=4, /* 3dnow */
00082     XED_ILD_MAP_XOP8=5,
00083     XED_ILD_MAP_XOP9=6,
00084     XED_ILD_MAP_XOPA=7, 
00085     /* FIXME:we might have invalid map (TNI maps) - in this case
00086      * we should check for it before looking up in tables for
00087      * modrm/imm/disp/static decoding
00088      * Also invalid map value cannot be 0xFF - we allocate 3 bits
00089      * for MAP operand in key for static lookup.
00090      */
00091     XED_ILD_INVALID_MAP
00092 } xed_ild_map_enum_t;
00093 
00094 #define ILD_ITEXT_MAX_BYTES 15
00095 
00096 #define XED_GRAMMAR_MODE_64 2
00097 #define XED_GRAMMAR_MODE_32 1
00098 #define XED_GRAMMAR_MODE_16 0
00099 
00100 typedef struct  {
00101     /* init/configuration variables */
00102     xed_bits_t mmode;  /* machine mode in XED GRAMMAR format: 0/1/2 */
00103     const xed_uint8_t* itext;
00104     xed_uint_t  max_bytes; 
00105     xed_uint_t out_of_bytes; /* 1 if max_bytes bound was reached while
00106                               * scanning itext 
00107                               */
00108 
00109     /* observed variables */
00110     xed_uint_t  length;    /* the observed length */
00111     
00112     /* to get the count of real legacy prefixes, subtract the number of rex
00113        prefixes from nprefixes.  There is only one rex prefix that is used;
00114        but any rex-s that are mixed-in with the legacy prefixes are
00115        ignored! We must count them. */
00116     xed_uint_t  nprefixes; /* count of legacy and rex prefixes */
00117     xed_uint_t  nrexes;    /* count of rex prefixes */
00118     
00119     xed_uint_t  nseg_prefexies; /* count of segment prefixes */
00120 
00121     
00122     xed_uint8_t found; /* NDY - found a valid inst */
00123     xed_uint8_t osz;  /* if 66 was observed */
00124     xed_uint8_t asz;  /* if 67 was observed */
00125     xed_uint8_t seg;  /* the last seg prefix */
00126     xed_uint8_t lock; /* 1 or 0 */
00127     xed_uint8_t f2;  /* 1 or 0 */
00128     xed_uint8_t f3;  /* 1 or 0 */
00129 
00130     xed_uint8_t modep5; /* 0, 1. XED_OPERAND_MODEP5
00131                          * If 1 the first f2/f3 prefix is taken*/
00132     xed_uint8_t p4; /* 0,1, XED_OPERAND_P4  */
00133     xed_uint8_t vv; /* XED_OPERAND_VEXVALID 0 for legacy, 1 for AVX */
00134     
00135     xed_uint8_t last_f2f3; /* f2 or f3 */
00136     xed_uint8_t first_f2f3;  /* f2 or f3 */
00137     xed_uint8_t rex; /* rex value */
00138     xed_uint8_t vex; /* c4 or c5 */
00139     xed_uint8_t nominal_opcode;
00140     xed_uint8_t nominal_opcode_position; /* 0 is first ... */
00141 
00142      /* required for sib processing */
00143     xed_uint8_t modrm; /* value of byte if has_modrm is nonzero*/
00144     
00145     xed_ild_map_enum_t map; 
00146     xed_uint8_t amd3dnow; /* 1 or 0 */
00147     xed_uint8_t rex_w;
00148     xed_uint8_t rex_r;
00149     xed_uint8_t rex_x;
00150     xed_uint8_t rex_b;
00151 
00152     xed_uint8_t vexdest3;
00153     xed_uint8_t vexdest210;
00154     xed_uint8_t vex_l;
00155     xed_uint8_t vex_pp;
00156     xed_uint8_t vex_w;
00157 
00158     /* decode-time derived variables */
00159     xed_bool_t has_modrm;
00160     xed_bool_t has_sib;
00161     xed_uint8_t imm_bytes;   /* 0=none, else 1,2,4,8 */
00162     /*has_imm1 is for AMD's double immediate insstructions */
00163     xed_uint8_t imm1_bytes;   /* 0=none, else 1,2 */
00164     xed_uint8_t disp_bytes;  /* 0=none, else 1,2,4,8 */
00165 
00166     /* position of the back-end bytes */
00167     xed_uint8_t pos_modrm;
00168     xed_uint8_t pos_sib;
00169     xed_uint8_t pos_imm;
00170     xed_uint8_t pos_imm1; //for AMD's second immediate
00171     xed_uint8_t pos_disp;
00172 
00173 
00174     xed_ild_extended_t ext;
00175 } xed_ild_t;
00176

00178                                  xed_machine_mode_enum_t mmode,
00179                                  const xed_uint8_t* itext,
00180                                  const xed_uint_t  max_bytes);

00194 xed_instruction_length_decode(xed_decoded_inst_t* d);

00205 xed_bits_t xed_ild_cvt_mode(xed_machine_mode_enum_t mmode);

00207 /* Special getter for RM  */
00208 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00209 xed_ild_get_rm(const xed_decoded_inst_t* ild) {
00210     /* Sometimes we don't have modrm, but grammar still
00211      * likes to use RM operand - in this case it is first
00212      * 3 bits of the opcode.
00213      */
00214     xed_uint8_t modrm;
00215     if (xed3_operand_get_has_modrm(ild))
00216         return xed3_operand_get_rm(ild);
00217     else 
00218         modrm = xed3_operand_get_nominal_opcode(ild);
00219         return xed_modrm_rm(modrm);
00220 }
00221 
00222 /* compressed operand getters */
00223 
00224 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00225 xed3_operand_get_mod3(const xed_decoded_inst_t* ild) {
00226     return xed3_operand_get_mod(ild) == 3;
00227 }
00228 
00229 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00230 xed3_operand_get_rm4(const xed_decoded_inst_t* ild) {
00231     return xed3_operand_get_rm(ild) == 4;
00232 }
00233 
00234 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00235 xed3_operand_get_vexdest210_7(const xed_decoded_inst_t* ild) {
00236     return xed3_operand_get_vexdest210(ild) == 7; 
00237 }
00238 
00239 static XED_INLINE void 
00240 xed3_check_set_ia_map(xed_decoded_inst_t* d, xed_uint8_t c4byte1){
00241     xed_uint8_t map = c4byte1 & 0x1F;
00242     if (map > XED_ILD_MAP3){
00243         xed3_operand_set_map(d,XED_ILD_INVALID_MAP);
00244     }
00245     else{
00246         xed3_operand_set_map(d,map);
00247     }
00248 }

00285 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00286 xed_ild_get_vexvalid(xed_ild_t* ild) {
00287 #if defined(XED3_GUARD)
00288     return ild->xed3_ops.vexvalid;
00289 #else
00290     return ild->vv;
00291 #endif
00292 }

00294 static XED_INLINE xed_uint_t
00295 xed_ild_get_vl(xed_ild_t* ild) {
00296     * If VL is overriden in extensions, vex_l should be set
00297      * in extensions' scanners.
00298      * This makes the getter simpler *
00299     return ild->vex_l;
00300 }
